pullRequest.body:
Added a discrete topology structure to `ZMod n` for all `n`

---

nodes.body: Thanks @jcommelin ! I have added both changes to the code. I am happy to delete this controversial lemma with two topologies on it as of now, and come back to it when needed. For now, having the topology on `ZMod` is crucial to my project.
@laughinggas can you please add docstrings for the two new defs, and move the lemma about embeddings between discrete spaces to a lower level file?

[`ZMod.instTopologicalSpace`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/ZMod.html#ZMod.instTopologicalSpace) now exists. Do you want to salvage the rest of the PR?

```suggestion
instance instTopologicalSpace {d : } : TopologicalSpace (ZMod d) := 
```

```suggestion
instance {d : } instDiscreteTopology : DiscreteTopology (ZMod d) := rfl
```
What are those attribute declarations even doing?
I am not really sure, in Lean 3, these were local instances which I could call when needed. I wanted to reproduce that.
I think these are probably fine as global instances?
Agreed. And also you're already declaring them to be global with the previous `instance` declarations. So I think your `attribute [local instance]` are ineffective.
I think an issue might be for n = 0, because we are then putting an instance of a discrete topology structure on the integers..
What other topology would you put? I would think discrete is the usual one.
It's worth checking that no non-defeq diamonds are created here; to ensure that, it might be necessary to define the topology via a case split
Why not make it a local instance instead?

> because we are then putting an instance of a discrete topology structure on the integers..

I think the integers already have this topology anyway?
Indeed, see `instTopologicalSpaceInt`

In fact, `Fin n` already has the topology too:

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/341dab4127bc6f4797c5905708551a23c0f82d01/Mathlib/Topology/Order.lean#L568-L572

So given that `ZMod` is always one of these two types, and both have this topology as a global instance, it's pretty clear that ZMod should also have these instances (but defined to have the right defeq)
Does the current definition not have the right defeq?
I don't think it is reasonable to import topology this early in the import hierarchy; can you put these results near wherever the discrete topology on `Nat` is established?
Is it alright if I create a new file? More lemmas will be coming in shortly, regarding the equivalence of the induced and `embedProduct` topologies on `Units (ZMod n)`
New file is fine!
Don't forget to delete this import
Done, thanks!
@YaelDillies @eric-wieser @mo271 How can I remove the ` Check all files imported (push) ` error?
You should read https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7286447002/job/19855177515?pr=9146 and add the line it's telling you to add to `Mathlib.lean`
Thanks, done!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (Units.coeHom (ZMod n)) inferInstance) _ (Units.inv : (ZMod n) ZMod n) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion TopologicalSpace.induced f = := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {f : X Y} (hf : Function.Injective f) : @DiscreteTopology X (TopologicalSpace.induced f tY) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion {f : X Y} (hf : Function.Injective f) : @DiscreteTopology X (TopologicalSpace.induced f tY) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion X Y} (hf : Function.Injective f) : @DiscreteTopology X (TopologicalSpace.induced f tY) := by ```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
#align zmod.inhabited ZMod.inhabited

```
IMHO, we should use the existing `Embedding.discreteTopology` instead of these two lemmas.
Done! I don't think there are any other places where I need the lemmas, so I removed them.
We have a canonical topology on the units. Why not use it?
I am trying to prove that the canonical topology on the units, `embedProduct` is the same as the induced topology. As a result, `Units.map PadicInt.toZModPow` is continuous.
Can you not use the universal property of the induced topology to state that `embedProduct` is the induced topology without actually fiddling with several topologies on the same type?

You should add this instance (if we don't have it yet):
```lean
@[to_additive]
instance {M : Type*} [Monoid M] [TopologicalSpace M] [DiscreteTopology M] :
    DiscreteTopology M :=
  .of_continuous_injective Units.continuous_val Units.ext
```
BTW, you can also have `Embedding Units.val` from `Units.embedding_val_mk`.

> You should add this instance (if we don't have it yet):
> 
> ```lean
> @[to_additive]
> instance {M : Type*} [Monoid M] [TopologicalSpace M] [DiscreteTopology M] :
>     DiscreteTopology M :=
>   .of_continuous_injective Units.continuous_val Units.ext
> ```

This exists

> Can you not use the universal property of the induced topology to state that `embedProduct` is the induced topology without actually fiddling with several topologies on the same type?

These are equivalent conditions, as shown in the lemma `top_eq_iff_cont_inv`

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h : @Continuous _ _ (TopologicalSpace.induced (Units.coeHom ) inferInstance) ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion TopologicalSpace.induced (Units.coeHom ) inferInstance = Units.instTopologicalSpaceUnits ```

I think we should try to avoid working with different topologies on a single space. Would the following lemmas cover your use case?
```lean
@[to_additive]
protected lemma continuous_inv : Continuous (fun u  u : M  M) := by
  rw [Units.continuous_iff]
  exact continuous_coe_inv, continuous_val

@[to_additive (attr := simps!)]
protected def homeomorph_inv : M  M :=
  { left_inv := fun _  rfl,
    right_inv := fun _  rfl,
    continuous_toFun := Units.continuous_inv,
    continuous_invFun := Units.continuous_inv }

lemma inducing_coe_iff : Inducing (coeHom M)  Inducing (fun u  u : M  M) :=
  fun h  h.comp (Units.homeomorph_inv.inducing),
   fun h  h.comp (Units.homeomorph_inv.inducing)

lemma embedding_coe_iff : Embedding (coeHom M)  Embedding (fun u  u : M  M) :=
  fun h  h.comp (Units.homeomorph_inv.embedding),
   fun h  h.comp (Units.homeomorph_inv.embedding)
```

Would the following lemmas cover your use case?
```lean
-- move this close to `continuous_of_discreteTopology`?
lemma embedding_of_discreteTopology {  : Type _} [TopologicalSpace ] [TopologicalSpace ]
    [DiscreteTopology ] [DiscreteTopology ] (f :   ) (hf : f.Injective) : Embedding f := by
  refine ?_, hf
  ext s
  constructor <;> intro
   rw [isOpen_induced_iff]
    use f '' s
    simp only [isOpen_discrete, hf, Set.preimage_image_eq, and_self]
   apply isOpen_discrete

lemma embedding_coeHom (d : ) : Embedding (Units.coeHom (ZMod d)) :=
  embedding_of_discreteTopology _ Units.ext

lemma embedding_coe_inv (d : ) : Embedding (fun u  u : (ZMod d)  (ZMod d)) :=
  Units.embedding_coe_iff.mp (embedding_coeHom d)
```

```suggestion
protected def homeomorph_inv : M  M where
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv _ := rfl
  continuous_toFun := Units.continuous_inv
  continuous_invFun := Units.continuous_inv
```
Please use generic `Homeomorph.inv` instead.

```suggestion

end Embedding
```

```suggestion
    [DiscreteTopology ] [DiscreteTopology ] (f :   ) (hf : f.Injective) : Embedding f :=
    inducing_of_discreteTopology , hf
```

We should have a `ContinuousInv` instance instead of a type-specific lemma. Then use [Homeomorph.inv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#Homeomorph.inv) instead of the next definition.

Something like:
```lean
instance : ContinuousInv M where
  continuous_inv := Units.continuous_iff.2 <| continuous_coe_inv, continuous_val
```

Then you can drop the `continuous_inv` line from the `TopologicalGroup` instance for `Units`.
Done!

Why not use `Units.val` instead of `coeHom` in the LHS? Also, LHS is simpler than RHS. I suggest
```suggestion
lemma inducing_val_inv_iff : Inducing (fun u  u : M  M)  Inducing (() : M  M) :=
```
In fact, I think that we should have `Homeomorph.inducing_comp_left_iff` and `Homeomorph.embedding_comp_left_iff`.

```suggestion
lemma Embedding.of_discreteTopology {  : Type*} [TopologicalSpace ] [TopologicalSpace ]
```
Please move this file to `Mathlib.Topology.Instances.ZMod`.
Done!

`Units.val` is the `simp`-normal form. Please use it here.
```suggestion
lemma embedding_units_coe (d : ) : Embedding (() : (ZMod d)  ZMod d) :=
```

This lemma should be moved and/or generalized. To avoid extra dependencies, you may either use the `of_discreteTopology` constructor again. Also, the name should mention `units` because it's not in the `Units` namespace.

BTW, could you please add the following lemma and a comment explaining that `Nat.cast` is not injective in this case, so it's not `Inducing`/`Embedding`?
```
lemma embedding_val (d : ) : Embedding (ZMod.val : ZMod d  )
```
Done the first part. Also did the second part, but I don't really understand what you mean..

As I said before, we already have [Homeomorph.inv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#Homeomorph.inv) that works for any type with involutive continuous `Inv.inv`, no need to define a new copy of it.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/ZMod/Defs): Topological structure on `ZMod`

@laughinggas can you please add docstrings for the two new defs, and move the lemma about embeddings between discrete spaces to a lower level file?

[`ZMod.instTopologicalSpace`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/ZMod.html#ZMod.instTopologicalSpace) now exists. Do you want to salvage the rest of the PR?
